intro: Ouratea parviflora var. pulchella, commonly known as the pink ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, pink or white flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy, dark green appearance, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. The plant prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for both container and in-ground cultivation.
